fordtitle_copy.description: Engine. Powertrain. Muscle. Call it what you will. But to us, that’s just the start of the story. What you choose to do with that power and wherever you choose to take it? That’s what really matters.
fordtitle_copy.title: Welcome to the Starting Line

fordtitle_copy_copy.description: From tire-squealing and dust-kicking… to kid-shuttling, load-hauling, and commute-crushing. Everybody’s driving needs are different. Let us help you choose the perfect engine that fits your life. Whether it’s high-octane, high-voltage, or something in-between.
fordtitle_copy_copy.title: Find the Power That’s Best for You

fordtitle.description: EcoBoost engine technology combines turbocharging, direct fuel injection and twin independent variable camshaft timing (Ti-VCT). It results in a smaller gas engine that pushes out impressive power. Today, you’ll find EcoBoost available on nearly every Ford vehicle we make. And for unique vehicle needs? The classic, naturally aspirated gas engine is still available on select cars and trucks.
fordtitle.title: Peak Petroleum Performance

fordtitle.description: The everyday benefits of electric. The effortless reliability of gas power. Get the advantages of each, working in seamless combination. With more models available than ever before, you’ll now find hybrid versions of many Ford trucks and SUVs. This includes a Ford Escape® Plug-In Hybrid, which provides a reliable range of all-electric power.
fordtitle.title: The Best of Both Worlds
What’s the right powertrain for me?

fordtitle.description: Next level acceleration. Powerful motors. A fully electric driving experience. Say “hello” to the future with Mustang Mach-E® and Ford F-150 Lightning®. And now, with the Ford Power Promise, you’ll be eligible for a complimentary home charger and standard installation*, 24/7 Live Support**, and Ford Roadside Assistance. Also get access to the BlueOval™ Charge Network—the largest public charging network in North America.†
fordtitle.title: Enter Electric Exhilaration

text.text: Based on EPA tailpipe rating. Visit www.fueleconomy.gov for more information

fordtitle.description: Hauling and towing. Pushing and pulling. Diesel-powered Ford Super Duty® trucks are constantly tested over the course of a workday. And to get the job done, power is prioritized above all. Diesel fuel is more energy dense, since it’s refined differently than gasoline – to help you to meet the daily demands of business.
fordtitle.title: The Drive to Work Harder

fordbutton_862924336.text: Get To Work With Ford Pro

item0.description:
• You seldom drive in the city, and do plenty of highway drivinghlo
  • You often take trips more than 150 miles from home
  • You're comfortable filling up at the corner gas station
item0.title: Gas Or Ecoboost If....

item1.description:
• You do a mix of city and highway driving
  • You want the benefits of both gas and electric power
  • Access to public charging stations is limited in your area
item1.title: Hybrid if…

item2.description:
• You do a lot of city/suburban driving
  • You have access to a garage or parking space that allows you to plug in at home
  • Zero-emission driving is important to you
item2.title: Electric if…

item3.description:
• Your day-to-day demands require considerable power
  • You seek best-in-class available torque
  • You prioritize strength over speed from an engine
item3.title: Diesel if...

fordtitle_copy.description: The tried-and-true gas engine still has its place in the Ford vehicle lineup. And beyond traditional internal combustion technology, there's also Ford EcoBoost®. EcoBoost engines combine turbocharging, direct fuel injection and twin independent variable camshaft timing (Ti-VCT).
fordtitle_copy.title: Gas Power, Accelerated

fordtitle_copy_copy.description: With impressive overall performance, EcoBoost provides the muscle of a bigger displacement engine with fuel economy in mind.
fordtitle_copy_copy.title: EcoBoost: Big Performance, Small Engine

item0.description:
• MPG  EPA-estimated rating of 23 city/30 hwy/26 combined MPG
    Average Range  EPA-estimated range of 429 miles
  • Average Fuel Cost  As little as $1,950 annually
item0.title: 2024 Maverick® XL 2.0L EcoBoost FWD

item1.description:
• MPG EPA-estimated rating of 27 city/34 hwy/30 combined MPG
    Average Range  EPA-estimated range of 444 miles
  • Average Fuel Cost As little as $1,800 annually
item1.title: 2024 Escape Active™ 1.5L EcoBoost FWD

item2.description:
• MPG  EPA-estimated rating of 22 city/33 hwy/26 combined MPG
    Average Range  EPA-estimated range of 416 miles
  • Average Fuel Cost  As little as $2,100 annually
item2.title: 2024 Mustang® 2.3L EcoBoost Fastback

item3.description:
• MPG   EPA-estimated rating of 21 city/25 hwy/22 combined MPG
    Average Range   EPA-estimated range of 414 miles
  • Average Fuel Cost   As little as $2,300 annually
item3.title: 2024 Ranger® XL 2.3L EcoBoost 4x2

fordtitle.description: Constantly adjusting and optimizing the engine and transmission operation as you drive. That’s just the beginning of what goes into EcoBoost engine performance.
fordtitle.title: How EcoBoost® Works

item0.description: The opening and closing of both the intake and exhaust valves are continuously adjusted while the engine is running. At peak demand, timing is controlled to help maximize the torque and power. This helps minimize fuel consumption during lower-load operation.
item0.title: Twin Independent Variable Camshaft Timing (Ti-VCT)

item1.description: Energy from engine exhaust—that would otherwise be wasted—now rotates in a turbine. Coupled to a compressor, incoming air is pressurized into the combustion chambers. In turn, it generates a virtually instantaneous surge of on-demand power… and significantly increases output per liter.
item1.title: Turbocharged Performance

item2.description: Direct injection takes a precise amount of fuel, delivered in a fine mist, fed directly into the combustion chamber. This helps to maximize power output when you need it.
item2.title: Direct Fuel Injection

fordtitle_copy_copy_.description: Ford Mustang® and Ford F-Series® trucks. These two Ford icons take traditional gasoline engine technology to the opposite extremes. From V8 power that needs a race track to contain it... to V8 engines that work hard and play hard, under the hoods of F-150® and Super Duty®.
fordtitle_copy_copy_.title: The Classic Gas Engine, Still a Powerful Choice

item0.description: It’s street-legal. But just barely. This modified version of the naturally aspirated Gen-4 5.0L Coyote™ V8 engine allows the 2024 Mustang Dark Horse™ coupe to unleash 500 horsepower and 418 lb.-ft. of torque68, on track days.
item0.title: 5.0L Ti-VCT V8

item1.description: Available on the 2024 F-150 Raptor R™ , it's the most powerful high-performance engine ever put in an F-150 truck.* 720 horsepower and 640 Ib.-ft. of torque** mean that adrenaline-pumping off-road excitement
item1.title: 5.2L Supercharged V8

item2.description: Select Super Duty° models offer the largest, most powerful gas engines available in their class. With a best-in-class maximum available 430 horsepower and 485 lb-ft. of torque,* it's ready for your workday.
item2.title: 7.3L OHV PFI V8

fordtitle_copy.description: From family haulers to jobsite workhorses, you won’t have to choose between gas or electric. You can get the best parts of both.
fordtitle_copy.title: Ford Hybrid Vehicles

fordtitle_copy_copy.description: Hybrid technology uses both a gas engine and an electric motor. You get the long-distance peace of mind that gas power delivers. For shorter everyday trips, you’ll see many benefits of electrification—including potential fuel economy savings over comparable gas-powered models. Ford Maverick® and Ford F-150® offer multiple hybrid models. In addition to basic hybrids, Ford Escape® also offers a Plug-In Hybrid for daily electric-only driving.
fordtitle_copy_copy.title: Optimize Your Drive

item0.description:
• MPG EPA-estimated rating of 42 city/33 hwy/37 combined MPG?
  • ﻿﻿Average Range EPA-estimated range of 511 miles
  • ﻿﻿Average Annual Fuel Cost $1,350 annually*

item2.title: 2024 F-150 LARIAT® 3.5L PowerBoost® Hybrid 4x4

item3.title: 2024 Escape® Platinum 2.5L Hybrid FWD

fordtitle_copy_copy_.description: Ford hybrid vehicles harness innovative and intelligent technology for exceptional driving convenience.
fordtitle_copy_copy_.title: How Hybrids Work

item0.description: Hybrid technology intuitively switches between gas, electric or a combination of both. The system automatically engages the electric motor when the gas engine isn't needed. This makes it a great option for stop-and-go urban driving.
item0.title: Ideal for City Driving

item1.description: No need to wait for most hybrids to charge. You charge every time you slow down. Regenerative braking captures energy to recharge the battery, so you're constantly powering up. Results may vary depending on driving habits.
item1.title: Regenerative Braking

fordtitle_copy_copy_.description: Between regular hybrids and a full EV, an Escape Plug-In Hybrid (PHEV) gives you impressive all-electric EPA-estimated range.* This means, for most daily driving, you can get by on battery power most of the time. You’ll also have gas-engine convenience for the occasional longer trips.
fordtitle_copy_copy_.title: Plug In and Level Up

item0.description: It lets you get up-to-the-minute charging updates, get insights on your charging history, and keep constant track of your energy usage. All from your smartphone.
item0.title: Harness the FordPass® App 164

item1.description: The Ford Mobile Power Cord offers an ideal way to recharge your Plug-In Hybrid. Plug it into a common 120V outlet, for everyday charging at home.
item1.title: Charge at Home

item2.description: This appears on screen each time the vehicle comes to a stop. It coaches you to brake in a manner which helps maximize the regenerative braking system. Used properly, it can train you to potentially recover over 90% of the energy spent during braking.
item2.title: Brake Coach Display
